intro: Searsia leptodictya, commonly known as the white stinkwood, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often eaten by birds and other wildlife. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various animals.
